Hi Jessica, 

Can you please try again and if it doesn't work, clear your cache. The date fields are not autofilling at our end anymore. 

Let me know?

Hi Joel,

Thank you.

Hmm I don't think that's a very good workaround. If it happens to me, you can imagine it can also happens to customers as well and we can't all expect them to clear this setting on their computer. It's just not a good customer experience.

There should be the ability for the autofill function to not show in the start and end date fields.

Kind Regards,

Jessica Torres

MARKETING COORDINATOR

P:

+61 8 8210 4000

M:

0488 336 744

E:

Jessica.Torres@RAMequipment.com.au

A:

181 Richmond Road, Richmond, SA 5033

Stay Connected

Hi Jessica,

We have updated the form to not allow past dates to be selected. 

Regarding the Autofill details, this might be on your browser settings, you can clear it through your settings. If you need a hand clearing it, just send us what browser and OS (Windows or Mac) you are using.

@Joel

Any ideas so users can’t select past dates?

I searched and found this:
gform.addFilter( 'gform_datepicker_options_pre_init', function( optionsObj, formId, fieldId ) {
// Apply to field 2 only
if ( fieldId == 2 ) {
optionsObj.minDate = 0;
}
return optionsObj;
});

But it crashed the site? I found it here: https://docs.gravityforms.com/gform_datepicker_options_pre_init/#9-disable-past-dates

Hi Heath,

This enquiry came through. We’re past September 4th now. Are we able to fix this so people can’t put in a start and end date that has already passed?

Also, when I go to fill in the details myself, it’s doing this annoying thing where it tries to autofill in the section for the dates with my name. This is only on desktop, don’t seem to have this issue on mobile.



Kind Regards,

Jessica Torres
MARKETING COORDINATOR
